intro: Gnaphalium globosum, commonly known as the globe thistle, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It features dense, spherical clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, upright stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. The plant's unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
